edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject

Class Enemy

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Character
      • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Enemy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Enemy
extends Character
    This class represents the enemy in the game. This class extends the Character class and will be given a position on the grid and a status of being alive or not.
    Author:
    Richard Pham, Oakar Kyaw, Ethan Liao, Jeremy Anunwah, Bennett Wong.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Enemy()
      The default constructor for the Enemy class.
      Enemy(int row, int column)
      This constructor takes in a position for the row and column in the grid.

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Character

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enemy

        public Enemy()
        The default constructor for the Enemy class. It will use the Character constructor to set the position and to also set the enemy to being alive.

      • Enemy

        public Enemy(int row,
             int column)
        This constructor takes in a position for the row and column in the grid. It will go back to using the constructor from the Character class.
        Parameters:
        row -
        column -
